response.message: I'm particularly excited about v2.0 of the API. I'm really looking forward to that.

"DevDays failed because we did not promise a thousand dollar piece of hardware to every attendee, like developers at BUILD got."

No its because it was unfortunately poorly executed...Sorry guys it really was.
BSc Comp Student using Trello to manage group projects. Would love a Trello T-Shirt!
I gotta say I always love the stacked podcast

Not all SE sites need to be technical. christianity is fine not being very technical. The worst thing about StackExchange sites is the expectation that every site must be technical, etc. It just is not ideal on more flimsy/opinion-related subjects like religion. The Internet is already great for finding facts and technical information, while StackExchange has an amazing format and solution for finding answers.

Unless there are consequences for not being prepared, there's little chance of having a behavior change. Reschedule the meeting. Nothing works automatically. 

Checklist Manifesto mentions the Van Halen M&M's.
This podcast was very much in the theme of morning rush hour radio show... and I loved it :)

This was the first time since you restarted the podcast that I listened again. I tried it for about half an hour, but then switched to something else because I didn't find it interesting.

That never happened with the older shows.
